Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: ArchieArcher Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I had a bad experience with this hotel starting with the moment I wanted to get into the room - the card reader for one of the 2 rooms I reserved was broken and I could get into the room only after trying it more than 20 times. After going down at the reception and explaining what the problem is, the guy just put the card through the reader on his desk and sent me away. I finally managed to get into the room after multiple retries. Next day it didn't work at all - I was lucky I was noticed by the cleaning team. Thanks to those ladies I got a new room. Otherwise, there was a girl at the reception looking always busy and upset, lots of noise coming from the bar across the street and not so nice area around the hotel. Won't go there again. The reason I went there this time is they had a good offer of 55E for 2 nights over the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Not the same good experience that I had with other Accor hotels.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was in berlin and was looking at budget hotel and I checked in to this hotel. Well the location was not quite in the town center which explains the low prices of the hotel, but they had also saved in one more part which came as an unpleasant surprise, There were no customary tea-coffee offered in the rooms free of cost(which probably all the accor hotels have). The location was a bit noisy as there`s a pool place bang opposite the hotel. The other things were quite standard so no complains about these. Cheers

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: CrazyCroat
Reviews.Content: Good and standard 3 star hotel.Location not great but very near metro and in 20 minutes you are in centum. From Schoefeld Airport you have direct bus that stops few meters from hotel. Room is good and clean, nice bathroom. If you are scared of ghosts than ask for a room on street side :). Yes, the cemetery is on one side of hotel but at least is quite. I wouldnt recommend any meal in hotel becuse just few meters from hotel is restaurant with unbelievable prices called LA SERRA http://www.laserra-berlin.de/. Check the prices on web site and food is very good. Bad thing there is no free Wi-fi internet you have to pay.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Price , Clean and Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Haluk70
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Ibis Berlin Neukolin during our visit to ITB Berlin. The hotel is clean and if you make a price/quality evaluation very reasonable like many Ibis Hotels in the world. The location is not prime but easly accessible with metro U7 line. Overall I can definitely recommend this hotel if you are looking a reasonable price with clean and good size rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A little bit far from the Center, but close to the metro”
Reviews.Author: laetitiaGermany
Reviews.Content: I had an ordinary stay at Ibis Berlin Neuköln, but I have to say that I´d prefered a more centralized Hotel, near the Postdamer Platz or the Museum Island. It is located near the metro station "Grenzalee", but it is a little bit dark there at night, and the trains doesn´t work until late. We had two problems while in this Hotel: it was hot and there was no air conditioning (at least it was not working at that time) and also the elevator doesn´t achieve the same level of the rooms, so we had to carry our luggage one level up. That was not a very good situation, and we got really mad about it.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: HisFussiness
Reviews.Content: I booked this solely on price and I am happy with it for the 60 or so Euros I paid. If you arrive late into Schonefeld it is on the right side of town and is only a 15 minute taxi ride on the newish motorway. My room was a good size but basic and in a kind of extension out back. 100 yards from the U-bahn, which connects into the S-bahn one stop away at Neukoelln, so an easy trip to the airport. There is a large supermarket adjacent to the Neukoelln S-bahn to stock up cheaply. Definitely not a touristy area, just a plain suburb, but as you're going to use the U-bahn to get anywhere in Berlin the location is just fine. I had no problems getting back to the hotel at 2am as the bahns run all night. The entire travelling public seemed to be drunk but in a good natured way.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: PaulandJulie
Reviews.Content: A comfortable hotel albeit a short distance from city centre. We stayed here on route to Berlin airport from Poland with a car, parking was no problem although it was a little difficult to find following the map in the IBIS brochure. Breakfast was nice inclusive in 70 euro price (double room). Our room was directly above the main entrance and we did have a little noise with the main door slamming shut. The room was clean and comfortable and we wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Friendly and Extremelly Clean!”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug186605
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for seven nights while in Berlin. It was excellent value for money and despite its location (abour half an hour on the underground to city centre) we would definately consider staying here again. The staff are extremelly welcoming, friendly and helpful. The hotel is open 24 hours a day which means that you can stay out as late as you like in Berlin enjoying the night life! The rooms are really clean and spacious, as is the whole hotel. We can't wait to return!!!

Reviews.Title: “60's Room with 60' Prices”
Reviews.Author: DJ FearRoss
Reviews.Content: A very budget hotel. If you are simply after a cheap but clean room I would recommend this hotel as the price is quite good. We paid around 45euros for a double for a night. The room had the most outdated deco i've ever seen but was still in good condition. Rooms have a mini bar and a not so dated on-suite bathroom. The hotel is near the underground and in a quite street so you can sleep well at night. All in all I would probably look for something else next time as I would stretch the budget to obtain something slightly better.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice for Berlin!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel during New Year period of 2003-2004 and were delighted, for the following reasons: - Genuine 3 star hotel in a new and refurbished building with modern and clean rooms - Hotel staffed 24 hours a day so you can come in late at night without any problem - Rates very cheap: 49 euros per day, for 2 adults, with breakfast included is one of the best bargains in Berlin - Extensive buffet breakfast including eggs, ham, salmon, yogurts, a wide variety of cheese,... - Hotel is located 100 metres from subway station Grenzallee (2 minutes walk and easy to carry luggage from subway to hotel) - Grenzallee subway station on a direct route to get to Tegel airport (no need to change subway line with luggages,...) - Excellent english speaking staff who can search and get "tourist information" when needed When we return to Berlin, we'll definitely stay at this hotel once more.

HotelInfo.Name: Ibis Berlin Neukoelln
HotelInfo.Address: Jahnstrasse 13, 12347 Berlin, Germany (Formerly Hotel Britzer Hof)
